author: Jess Bravin
title: Supreme Court to Decide Fate of Public-Sector Unions
text:
WASHINGTON—Public-employee unions face a reckoning Monday when the Supreme Court hears a long-anticipated lawsuit seeking to strip them of the power to bill collective-bargaining costs to employees who don’t want to pay.
The case arrives at the court as a dispute between a state employee in Springfield, Ill., and the union that represents his bargaining unit over a $45 monthly payroll deduction. The stakes are much higher: A ruling for the plaintiff would sap the strength of public-employee unions in states where they have... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
